selected_quotes: So geht Wissenschaft! Beim Kristallzüchten passiert ein Fehler. Statt das Zeug wegzuwerfen, studieren und entdecken
Scientists create multiple intrinsically identical single-photon emitters in the solid state for quantum optics

citation.abstract: Emitters of indistinguishable single photons are crucial for the growing field of quantum technologies. To realize scalability and increase the complexity of quantum optics technologies, multiple independent yet identical single-photon emitters are required. However, typical solid-state single-photon sources are inherently dissimilar, necessitating the use of electrical feedback or optical cavities to improve spectral overlap between distinct emitters. Here we demonstrate bright silicon vacancy (SiV(-)) centres in low-strain bulk diamond, which show spectral overlap of up to 91% and nearly transform-limited excitation linewidths. This is the first time that distinct single-photon emitters in the solid state have shown intrinsically identical spectral properties. Our results have impact on the application of single-photon sources for quantum optics and cryptography.
citation.title: Multiple intrinsically identical single-photon emitters in the solid state

wikipedia.title: Silicon-Vacancy Centre
wikipedia.summary: The Silicon Vacancy Centre (SiV) is an optically active defects in diamond (referred to as a colour centres) that is receiving an increasing amount of interest in the diamond research community.
